header.title: Simple, transparent pricing
header.subtitle: Choose the plan that fits your needs

promotion.title: Early Access: Pro features FREE!
promotion.description: Sign up now and enjoy Pro features at no cost during our launch period

specview.question: What is an AI Spec Document?
specview.answer: An AI Spec Document automatically organizes your test cases into domains, features, and behaviors. It helps you understand your test status at a glance.

analysis.question: What is Analysis?
analysis.answer: Analysis parses your repository's test files and extracts test cases, frameworks, and statistics. It's the foundation for understanding your test suite.

paymentLive.question: When will payments go live?
paymentLive.answer: We're currently in early access. Paid plans will be introduced in the first half of this year. Early users will receive special benefits and advance notice.

retention.question: What is data retention?
retention.answer: Retention period determines how long you can access your dashboard history and generated AI spec documents. Repository analysis results are kept regardless of your plan.

landing.title: Documentation
landing.description: Learn how SpecVital works and get the most out of your test analysis.

testDetection.title: Test Detection
testDetection.description: Understanding how SpecVital finds and counts tests in your repository.

usageBilling.title: Usage & Billing
usageBilling.description: Learn about usage tracking, quotas, and billing cycles.

specviewGeneration.title: AI Spec Generation
specviewGeneration.description: How AI transforms your tests into structured specification documents.

writingGuide.title: Test Writing Guide
writingGuide.description: Learn how to write tests and organize your project for optimal analysis results.

meta.title: Usage & Billing | SpecVital Docs
meta.description: Learn about usage tracking, quotas, cache behavior, and billing cycles in SpecVital.

usageBilling.title: Usage & Billing
usageBilling.subtitle: Understanding how usage is tracked and when quotas reset.

whatCounts.title: What Counts as Usage?
whatCounts.description: SpecVital tracks usage for two main features: Analysis runs and AI Spec Document generation. Not all actions count toward your quota.

keyPoint.title: Cached Results Are Free
keyPoint.description: Viewing cached analysis results never counts as usage. You're only charged when new work is performed.

analysisRun.name: Analysis Run
analysisRun.description: Parsing test files from a repository

specDocGeneration.name: AI Spec Doc Generation
specDocGeneration.description: AI generates specification document (counted by test count)

usageTypes.title: Two Types of Usage
usageTypes.description: SpecVital has separate quotas for different features, each tracked independently.

analysis.title: Analysis Runs
analysis.description: Counted each time you analyze a repository. One run per repository, regardless of test count.
analysis.item1: Initial analysis of a new repository
analysis.item2: Reanalysis after new commits or parser updates

specview.title: AI Spec Docs
specview.description: Counted by the number of tests in the generated document. More tests = more usage.
specview.item2: Regenerating uses the new test count

cache.title: Cache Behavior
cache.description: SpecVital caches analysis results to save your quota and speed up access. Understanding when cache is used helps optimize your usage.

sameCommit.name: Same commit, same parser
sameCommit.description: Viewing a repository you already analyzed

newCommit.name: New commits available
newCommit.description: Cached results are shown. You can choose to update via the banner.

parserUpdate.name: Parser updated
parserUpdate.description: Cached results are shown. You can choose to reanalyze via the banner.

manualReanalysis.name: Manual reanalysis
manualReanalysis.description: Clicking 'Update Now' or 'Reanalyze' runs a fresh analysis

tip.title: Efficient Usage
tip.description: Cached results are served instantly and never count toward your quota. Only update when you need the latest analysis.

specDocCache.title: AI Spec Doc Regeneration Cache
specDocCache.description: When regenerating AI spec documents, you can choose to reuse previous results. Only new or changed tests are regenerated by AI, saving your quota.

cycle.title: Billing Cycle
cycle.description: Your usage quota resets monthly. The reset date is based on when you first signed up.

howItWorks.title: How Monthly Reset Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: Your billing cycle starts on the day you create your account.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Usage accumulates for one calendar month from your start date.
howItWorks.step3Desc: When your monthly cycle ends, your usage counters reset to zero automatically.

limits.title: Plan Limits
limits.description: Each plan has different monthly limits for analysis and AI spec generation. Paid plans also benefit from a priority processing queue for faster analysis.

warnings.title: Quota Warnings
warnings.description: SpecVital warns you before you run out of quota so you can plan accordingly.

approaching.title: Approaching Limit (70%)
approaching.description: When you reach 70% of your quota, you'll see a warning indicator in the UI. Consider upgrading or waiting for reset.

exceeded.title: Quota Exceeded (100%)
exceeded.description: When you hit your limit, you won't be able to perform new analyses or generate spec docs until reset. Existing results remain accessible.

q1.question: Does viewing cached results use my quota?
q1.answer: No. Viewing previously analyzed results is always free. Usage is only counted when new analysis or generation work is performed.

q2.question: What happens when I exceed my quota?
q2.answer: You won't be able to start new analyses or generate new spec documents until your quota resets. All existing results remain accessible, and you can still browse, search, and export.

q3.question: Does regenerating a spec doc count as usage?
q3.answer: It depends on the mode. With 'Use cache', only new or changed tests consume quota — previous results are reused. With 'Fresh analysis', all tests are regenerated and the full test count is consumed.

q4.question: Can I buy more quota mid-cycle?
q4.answer: Currently, quota cannot be purchased separately. You can upgrade your plan for higher limits. We're considering usage-based options for the future.

meta.title: Test Detection | SpecVital Docs
meta.description: Learn how SpecVital detects and counts tests in your repository using AST-based static analysis.

testDetection.title: Test Detection
testDetection.subtitle: Understanding how SpecVital finds and counts tests in your repository.

what.title: What is Test Detection?
what.description: SpecVital uses AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) based static analysis to detect tests in your codebase. Unlike CLI tools that execute tests, SpecVital parses source code directly to identify test functions, suites, and their status.

keyPoint.title: Static Analysis
keyPoint.description: Tests are analyzed without execution. This means results are available in seconds, not hours - no CI/CD setup required.

how.title: How It Works
how.description: SpecVital uses Tree-sitter based AST parsing to analyze source code across 10+ programming languages and 20+ testing frameworks. Tests are detected using import statements, config scope, and content patterns.

status.title: Test Status Detection
status.description: SpecVital detects test status based on framework-specific modifiers and attributes:

staticAnalysis.title: Static Analysis Limitations
staticAnalysis.description: As a static analysis tool, SpecVital parses source files independently without executing code. This means parameterized test counts, dynamic imports, and cross-file references may not be fully resolved. For exact test counts, use your framework's native CLI.

accuracy.title: Accuracy Expectations
accuracy.description: For projects using standard testing patterns, SpecVital achieves high accuracy. Projects with heavy parameterization or custom test infrastructure may see lower accuracy.

typical.title: 95-99% Accuracy
typical.description: Most projects using standard patterns will see highly accurate test counts. For exact counts, use your framework's native CLI (jest --listTests, pytest --collect-only).

q1.question: How often is the parser updated?
q1.answer: The parser is updated regularly to support new framework versions and patterns. When an update affects your results, you'll see a banner suggesting reanalysis.

meta.title: AI Spec Generation | SpecVital Docs
meta.description: Learn how AI transforms your tests into structured specification documents.

specviewGeneration.title: AI Spec Generation
specviewGeneration.subtitle: Understanding how AI analyzes tests and generates specification documents.

overview.title: What is AI Spec Generation?
overview.description: AI Spec Generation automatically turns your test suite into a structured specification document. Instead of reading through hundreds of test files, you get a clear overview of what your project does — organized by business area and written in plain language.

keyPoint.title: Tests as Living Documentation
keyPoint.description: Your test suite already describes how your system behaves. AI Spec Generation makes this knowledge readable and shareable with your entire team — developers, QA, and stakeholders alike.

domains.title: Organized by Domain
domains.description: Tests are grouped into business domains and features, so you can quickly see what each part of your project covers.

descriptions.title: Readable Descriptions
descriptions.description: Technical test names like 'should_return_404_when_not_found' become clear behavior descriptions like 'Returns 404 when the resource is not found'.

summary.title: Project Summary
summary.description: An auto-generated overview that describes what your project does based on its test coverage — great for onboarding and documentation.

caching.title: Smart Caching
caching.description: Results are cached automatically. When you regenerate, only changed tests are reprocessed — saving time and quota.

namesBased.title: Based on Test Metadata
namesBased.description: The AI works with test names, file paths, and imports — not the actual test implementation. The quality of the output depends on how descriptive your test names are.

nameQuality.title: Cryptic Names, Lower Quality
nameQuality.description: Tests with vague or abbreviated names (e.g., 'test1', 'checkA') will produce less useful descriptions. The more descriptive the name, the better the result.

languageSupport.title: Multi-language Support
languageSupport.description: Spec documents can be generated in 24 languages. English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese, and Spanish produce the best results.

relatedGuide.title: Want better results?
relatedGuide.description: Learn how to write and organize tests for higher-quality spec documents in the Test Writing Guide.

q1.question: How is usage counted?
q1.answer: Only newly generated descriptions count toward your quota. If a test was already processed before, the cached result is reused for free. Regenerating an unchanged repository costs nothing.

q2.question: Can I edit the generated document?
q2.answer: Documents are read-only in SpecVital, but you can export them as Markdown and edit them in any text editor or documentation system.

q3.question: When should I regenerate?
q3.answer: Regenerate after significant changes to your test suite — such as adding new features or major refactoring. For active projects, after each sprint or milestone is a good cadence.

meta.title: Test Writing Guide | SpecVital Docs
meta.description: Learn how to write tests and organize your project for optimal analysis results.

writingGuide.title: Test Writing Guide
writingGuide.subtitle: Structure your tests for accurate analysis and high-quality spec documents.

pipeline.title: How SpecVital Works
pipeline.description: SpecVital uses AST-based static analysis to understand your test codebase. Knowing how this pipeline works helps you get the most accurate results.

detect.title: Test Detection
detect.description: Scans your repository for test files using naming patterns and directory conventions.

parse.title: AST Parsing
parse.description: Statically analyzes test files with tree-sitter to extract test structure, suite hierarchy, and status.

analyze.title: Analysis
analyze.description: Generates a comprehensive test inventory with framework detection, status breakdown, and structural insights.

specDocument.title: Spec Document
specDocument.description: Optionally, AI organizes analysis results into domain-grouped specification documents.

keyPoint.title: Well-Structured Code, Better Results
keyPoint.description: Well-structured test code leads to more accurate analysis. If you also use spec document generation, analysis quality directly impacts document quality.

testNaming.title: Naming Tests
testNaming.description: Test names are the single most impactful factor for analysis quality. Descriptive names improve both the analysis breakdown and spec document generation.

contextNote.title: Domain Context Enhances Results
contextNote.description: SpecVital uses domain information (suite path, file path, imports) alongside test names. Even brief test names can produce reasonable descriptions when rich domain context is available.

pattern.title: Use should/when Pattern
pattern.description: Names like 'should [action] when [condition]' or '[action] when [condition]' produce the clearest analysis results.

specific.title: Be Specific
specific.description: Include specific conditions, expected values, and edge cases in the test name. Avoid generic verbs like 'works' or 'handles'.

testStructure.title: Structuring Tests
testStructure.description: Suite hierarchy is key structural information that SpecVital extracts. Nesting tests into meaningful groups provides rich context for both analysis and spec generation.

bad.title: Flat Structure
bad.description: Without suite hierarchy, analysis lacks grouping context.

good.title: Nested Structure
good.description: Nested test groups provide clear structural context for analysis.

tip.title: Suite Path = Structural Context
tip.description: The full suite path (e.g., 'AuthService > Login') gives SpecVital the context needed to understand how tests relate to each other and to your application's architecture.

fileOrganization.title: Organizing Test Files
fileOrganization.description: File paths are a strong signal for understanding your project structure. Well-organized test files lead to accurate grouping in both analysis and spec documents.

bad.title: Avoid
bad.description: All tests in a single directory lose path-based structural signals.

good.title: Recommended
good.description: Domain-aligned directories provide strong structural signals.

naming.title: Follow Framework Conventions
naming.description: Use standard naming patterns your framework expects: *.test.ts, *.spec.ts, *_test.go, *Test.java, test_*.py, and so on.

colocation.title: Co-locate Tests with Source
colocation.description: Keeping tests near source code (e.g., __tests__/ in the same directory) provides clear path-based structural signals.

separation.title: Separate by Domain
separation.description: Organize test directories by business domain (auth/, payment/, user/) rather than by test type (unit/, integration/).

architecture.title: Project Architecture
architecture.description: Import statements and function calls within tests are extracted as domain hints during analysis. These signals help SpecVital understand which parts of your application each test covers.

bad.title: Weak Signals
bad.description: Generic utility imports provide no domain context.

good.title: Strong Signals
good.description: Domain-specific imports clearly indicate business area.

tip.title: Domain-Specific Imports Matter Most
tip.description: When your tests import from domain-specific modules (e.g., @/services/auth, @/api/payment), SpecVital can accurately identify which part of your application is being tested. Generic utility imports provide no useful signal.

roadmap.title: Coming Soon: AI-Guided Tools
roadmap.description: We're building MCP (Model Context Protocol) integration that brings SpecVital's analysis capabilities directly into your IDE. These tools will help you improve your test code based on analysis results.

naming.title: Test Name Improvement
naming.description: Detect cryptic test names and suggest descriptive alternatives for better analysis results.

structure.title: Structure Refactoring
structure.description: Suggest converting flat test files into well-organized suite hierarchies.

preview.title: Analysis Preview
preview.description: Preview how your tests will be analyzed and grouped before committing changes.

architecture.title: Architecture Diagnostics
architecture.description: Analyze your project's test file organization and import patterns, with suggestions for improvement.

aiToolConfig.title: AI Tool Configuration
aiToolConfig.description: Most tests today are written with AI coding assistants. Add SpecVital-aware rules to your AI tool so generated tests produce optimal analysis results.

suiteHierarchy.title: Require Suite Hierarchy
suiteHierarchy.description: Instruct your AI to always wrap tests in nested suite groups that name the domain and feature. The suite path is the strongest structural signal.

behaviorNames.title: Enforce Behavior Names
behaviorNames.description: Test names should describe behavior, not implementation. Names like "rejects expired token" are converted directly into spec descriptions.

domainPaths.title: Mirror Domain in Paths
domainPaths.description: Tell your AI to place test files in directories that reflect business domains (e.g., tests/auth/, tests/order/) instead of generic directories.

domainImports.title: Import Real Modules
domainImports.description: Require importing actual domain services and modules under test. Import statements are the strongest signal for domain classification.

dialog.title: Recommended Prompt Template
dialog.description: Copy this into your AI tool's rule or configuration file (e.g., CLAUDE.md, .cursorrules, copilot-instructions.md).
